arm_group.description: Patients undergoing a surgical bladder procedure in the main O.R.

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this pilot study is to develop the methodology for an innovative subsurface
      imaging technology that was designed at Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory. It will
      allow the non-invasive analysis and imaging of tissues and chemical distributions in the
      body at an imaging depth of up to 1 centimeter with spatial resolution on the order of 1 mm.

clinical_study.brief_title: Endoscopic Subsurface Optical Imaging for Cancer Detection

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a pilot, feasibility study to determine if the subsurface imaging technology
      warrants advancement to a larger clinical trial.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Patient must be scheduled for a bladder procedure (TURBT or Cystectomy) at the
             University of California Davis Medical Center.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Non bladder surgical procedures at University of California Davis Medical Center.

study_pop.textblock: Patients already scheduled to undergo a bladder surgery at UCDMC.

clinical_study.official_title: Endoscopic Subsurface Optical Imaging for Cancer Detection

primary_outcome.description: Does the subsurface laser allow enough light to visually assess the cells. Logical metric of either "Yes" or "No".
primary_outcome.measure: Accuracy of the subsurface laser to determine cancer cells versus normal cells when viewed endoscopically during a surgical procedure.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Prospective
